meanings.definition: To make a remark or comment.
meanings.sent1: She reparks on the movie, saying it was funny.
meanings.sent2: He always reparks on the weather when he has nothing else to talk about.
meanings.sent3: During the meeting, he couldn't help but reparks on the boss's tie.
meanings.sent4: Her reparks on the new policy were met with mixed reactions.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's reparks on the student's project were helpful for improvement.

meanings.sent1: He reparks his request for a raise with more confidence this time.
meanings.sent2: The child kept reparks the same question until he got an answer.
meanings.sent3: She had to reparks her order at the restaurant because it was incorrect.
meanings.sent4: The echo in the canyon reparks his words, creating a surreal effect.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the student to reparks the answer for clarity.

meanings.definition: To stop a vehicle and leave it temporarily in a specific place.
meanings.sent1: He reparks his car in the parking lot before heading into the store.
meanings.sent2: She quickly reparks her bike outside the library before going in.
meanings.sent3: The delivery truck reparks in front of the building to unload the packages.
meanings.sent4: The tour bus reparks at the designated area for sightseeing.
meanings.sent5: Drivers must reparks their vehicles properly to avoid congestion.
